alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:31PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Essex, western Addison and northwestern Rutland Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 130 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Panton to near Moriah to near Minerva. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy Rainfall SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vergennes, Middlebury, Moriah, Crown Point, Westport, Minerva, Cornwall, Weybridge, Schroon Lake, Orwell, Monkton, Monkton Boro, New Haven, Port Henry, Addison, Shoreham, Ferrisburg, Waltham, Panton, and D A R State Park. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 82 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
